alert.note: Alert for Grant; Owen; Pendleton (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 19 at 11:30PM EDT until May 20 at 2:00AM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 230 AM EDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Northern Kentucky, including the following counties, Grant, Owen and Pendleton. * WHEN...Until 230 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1130 PM EDT, radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Williamstown, Morgan, Corinth, Cherry Grove, Keefer, Lawrenceville, Camp Northward, Cordova, Stewartsville, New Columbus, Holbrook, Marcus, Natlee, Needmore, Elk Lake, Goforth and Beechwood.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. To report flooding, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
